Yes, there are several films where the music is almost a character in itself. Some examples include:

1. Whiplash (2014) - The film is about a young jazz drummer who aspires to be the best in the world, and the music serves as a way to showcase his talents and his struggles.

2. Almost Famous (2000) - The film is set in the early 1970s and follows a young music journalist who is assigned to cover a rising rock band. The music plays a central role in the film and is used to transport the audience back to that era.

3. Moulin Rouge! (2001) - The film is a musical that combines popular songs from various eras to tell the story of a young writer who falls in love with a famous courtesan.

4. School of Rock (2003) - The film is about a failed musician who becomes a substitute teacher and decides to turn his class into a rock band. The music is a key element of the film and helps to inspire and empower the young students.

These are just a few examples, but there are many other films where the music plays a vital role in the storytelling and becomes almost a character in itself.
